parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Money, riches, possessions. Something useful or needed, i.e. Wealth, price.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
